The Berlin tunes really make it. The crest: “Let's Face the Music and Dance” (2 hrs. 10 mins.) (11)The Honeymooners (13)SVISIONS: “Liza's Pioneer Diary” (R)

SATURDAY

8 P.M. (9). “Tiger Bay” (1959). Hayley Mills, Horst Buchholz. Tense and touching.

11:30 P.M. (5) “Yellow Submarine” (1968). Dandy animation around Beatles image.

SUNDAY

3:45 P.M. (11) “The Best Years of Our Lives” (1946). Fredric March, Myrna Loy, Dana Andrews. One of the best.

8 P.M. (5) “42d Street” (1933). Warner Baxter, Bebe Daniels, Dick Powell, Ruby Keeler. Tap-tap-terrific still.

8 P.M. (5) “Gold Diggers of 1933” (1933). Dick Powell, Joan Blondell, Ruby Keeler. Nice gold filling.

9 P.M. (7) “Serpico” (1973). Al Pacino, John Randolph. Stinging and stimulating.

11 P.M. (9) “All Quiet on the Western Front” (1930). Lew Ayres, Louis Wolheim. Towering, shattering.

Gladys Knight performs with her singing group, The Pips, on “The Midnight Special,” 1 A.M., Channel 4.
